bibl.title: Letter from William D. Kelly to John J. Moran, March 8, 1938

div1.p: Kelly requests permission to display Moran's name in the credits of the M.G.M. motion picture “Yellow Jack.”

div1.head: Letter from William D. Kelly to John J. Moran, March 8, 1938
div1.opener:
METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER PICTURES
Columbus, Ohio
March 8-1938
Mr. John J. Moran
C/o Sunoco De Cuba
102-A Avenida Menocal
Havana, Cuba
Dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
My company, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer has purchased Sidney Howard's
and Paul DeKruif's play “YELLOW JACK” and are now producing it,
and as in the play we will use fictitious characters and
fictitious names for the characters and take certain liberties
that are necessary for dramatic purposes, however, we feel that
the men who took part in yellow fever experiments should be
given credit at the end of the picture in a title which we feel
at this time will read as follows:
“Yellow Jack” celebrates what these men did,
rather than what they were. That their
heroism, however, should not go unrecorded,
their true names are here given:
ROBERT P. COOKE
LEVI E. FOLK
WARREN G. JERNEGAN
JOHN KISSENGER
JOHN J. MORAN

Folk and Jernegan as you know have gone on, therefore, I am
writing to yourself, John Kissenger and Dr. Cooke asking
permission to use this title at the end of the picture.
May we have your permission?

I am attaching a form that could be used for giving us the
permission.
div1.closer:
Yours truly, Wm. D. Kelly
METRO-GOLDWYN-MAYER PICTURES
1540 Broadway
New York City 1 cc airmail
1 cc regular mail
Encl-s.a. envelope
